intro: Hemiandrina sarawakensis, commonly known as the Sarawak hemiandrin, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of primary forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
